name: Silver Tips No.14
description: Gurkha White Tea from Shree Antu, Ilam, Nepal The Queen of Ilam, the drink of Emperors This Nepalese white tea is made using only the young unopened buds which are individually hand plucked during the early mornings, and often under the thick passing clouds, making it difficult and time consuming to harvest. Hence only a small amount is produced each year, making it one of the rarest teas to come from Nepal. Goes through very little to no oxidation and it has very light and delicate taste, with flowery aroma and sweet aftertaste. An exquisite experience. The individual tips are silky in appearance and covered in tiny hairs giving it its silvery appearance. Brewing. Suggested portion is 1 teaspoon per cup. Use freshly drawn water, (filtered or mineral water for best flavours) around 75-80°C. Brew for 4-5 mins according to taste. Do not add milk or sugar. You can reuse the tips for multiple infusions. Available in different sizes and packaging.

name: Golden Tips No.19
description: Gurkha Black Tea from Shree Antu, Ilam, Nepal The King’s Gold, Raja’s favourite drink This is the most sought after of all Nepalese black tea, with its distinctive golden orange liquor. Drunk by Royalties, and known for being the favourite tea Nepal’s Rajas. It has a pronounced sweet gentle aroma, and well-rounded smooth flavour with no astringency. Made entirely of the young unopened buds which are individually hand plucked and processed, this helps to give it a fine almost royal character. A must try. The individual tips are silky in appearance and covered in fine hairs giving it its shiny golden-orange appearance. Brewing Suggested portion is 1 teaspoon per cup. Use freshly drawn water, (filtered or mineral water for best flavours) around 75-80°C. Brew for 4-5 mins according to taste. Do not add milk or sugar. You can reuse the tips for multiple infusions. Available in different sizes and packaging.

name: Ilam Black Tea No.9
description: Gurkha Super Fine Black Tea from Shree Antu, Ilam, Nepal Grade: SFTGFOP, Year: 2012 This Nepalese black tea is the traditional tea drunk in the hill of Nepal. Grown in the foothills of Mt Kanchenjunga and produced using the oldest method of production, knows as orthodox. Where the whole leaves are rolled and processed, giving the distinctive appearance. The large leaf unfurl once brewed. Characterized by its copperish-orange liquor, fine aroma, and delicate flavours which make this a wonder tea for any time of the day. Brewing Suggested portion is 1 teaspoon per cup. Use freshly drawn water. Brew for 3-4 mins according to taste. Longer brew will result in strong yet slightly bitter taste. Recommended without milk or sugar. You can reuse the leave for multiple infusions. Available in different sizes and packaging.

name: Green Tea No.8
description: Gurkha Green Tea from Shree Antu, Ilam, Nepal Harvest Year: 2012 This tea was crafted by our trained tea masters using a mixture of traditional Chinese and Nepalese techniques to produce a wonderfully smooth and aromatic green tea. Made from the top two leaves and a bud, carefully hand plucked at high elevation meaning its rich in antioxidants and low in caffeine content which makes this an ideal health drink. Gurkha green tea has a slightly sweet taste, aromatic golden green liquor and a lingering fresh after taste. This delicate tea can be enjoyed any time of the day. Brewing Suggested portion is 1 teaspoon per cup. Use freshly drawn water. Around 85°C. Brew for 3-4 mins according to taste. Longer brew will result in strong yet slightly bitter taste. Recommended without milk or sugar. You can reuse the leaves for multiple infusions. Available in different sizes and packaging.

name: Ilam Black Tea No.7
description: Gurkha Fine Black Tea from Shree Antu, Ilam, Nepal Grade: FTGFOP, Harvest Year: 2012 This Nepalese black tea is the traditional tea drunk in the hill of Nepal. Grown in the foothills of Mt Kanchenjunga and produced using the oldest method of production, knows as orthodox. Where the whole leaves are rolled and processed, giving the distinctive appearance. The large leaf unfurl once brewed. Characterized by its copperish-orange liquor, fine aroma, and delicate flavours which make this a wonder tea for any time of the day. Brewing Suggested portion is 1 teaspoon per cup. Use freshly drawn water. Brew for 3-4 mins according to taste. Longer brew will result in strong yet slightly bitter taste. Recommended without milk or sugar. You can reuse the leave for multiple infusions. Available in different sizes and packaging.

name: Lemongrass No.29
description: Gurkha Black Tea Blend from Shree Antu, Ilam, Nepal Lemongrass grass blend crafted using traditional Nepalese black Himalayan tea, grown in the foothills of Mt Kanchenjunga and fine lemongrass from Terai plains of Nepal. The two ingredients combine to produce a superb tea with it's distinct citrus taste and wonderful aroma. Lemongrass is well know for its use in detoxifying the body, aiding with digestion and relieving nausea. A good healthy brew to refresh your body. Ingredients: Black tea & Lemongrass Brewing Suggested portion is 1 teaspoon per cup. Use freshly drawn water. Brew for 3-4 mins according to taste. Longer brew will result in strong yet slightly bitter taste. Recommended without milk or sugar. Available in different sizes and packaging.

name: Sencha Green Tea No.6
description: Nepalese Sencha Green Tea It has a long distinctive silky needle like leaves and smooth dark green appearance. This is the famed Japanese style tea produced in the hills of Shree Antu, Nepal with leaves hand plucked at high elevation meaning it’s rich in antioxidants and low in caffeine content making this an ideal health drink. The brewed liquor is golden green in appearance, with rich grassy aroma and vegetal taste. It’s full of character and flavour. Brewing Suggested portion is 1 teaspoon per cup. Use freshly drawn water. Around 85°C. Brew for 3-4 mins according to taste. Longer brew in very hot will result tea that is more astringent. Recommended without milk or sugar. You can reuse the leaves for multiple infusions. Available in different sizes and packaging.

name: Masala Chai No.28
description:
Gurkha Masala Tea Blend A classic masala blend from Nepal. This blend was created using our own family recipe, that we enjoy everyday. To make this a truly authentic chai from the hills we used locally grown spices from Ilam district in eastern Nepal. Aromatic and flavoursome tea. Ingredients: Black tea, Cinnamon, Cardamon, Lemongrass & Ginger. Brewing Suggested portion is 1 teaspoon per cup. Use freshly drawn water. Brew for 3-4 mins according to taste. Longer brew may result in strong yet slightly bitter taste. Little bit of milk and sugar maybe added.

Round and Square Tins are SOLD OUT

Available in different sizes and packaging.

name: Gurkha Tea Taster Pack
description:
Try our Taster pack to taste four of our best selling teas.

They include:
	•	Sliver Tips No.14 (5g)
	•	Golden Tips No.19 (5g)
	•	Ilam Tea No.9 (20g)
	•	Green Tea No.8 (20g)

A perfect introduction to our range of white, black and green teas.

name: Bulk - Green Tea No.8
description: Gurkha Green Tea from Shree Antu, Ilam, Nepal Buy tea in bulk. Choose from 500g or 1kg bags, Harvest Year: 2012 This tea was crafted by our trained tea masters using a mixture of traditional Chinese and Nepalese techniques to produce a wonderfully smooth and aromatic green tea. Made from the top two leaves and a bud, carefully hand plucked at high elevation meaning its rich in antioxidants and low in caffeine content which makes this an ideal health drink. Gurkha green tea has a slightly sweet taste, aromatic golden green liquor and a lingering fresh after taste. This delicate tea can be enjoyed any time of the day. Brewing Suggested portion is 1 teaspoon per cup. Use freshly drawn water. Around 85°C. Brew for 3-4 mins according to taste. Longer brew will result in strong yet slightly bitter taste. Recommended without milk or sugar. You can reuse the leaves for multiple infusions. Remember there are no right or wrong way to brew. We are all individuals and like are our tea in different ways, so experiment according to your preference. Choose weight from below

name: Gift Bag
description: Gift of Tea Lovely handcrafted bag made using handmade Lokta paper (Nepalese paper), packed with 100g of the the finest loose leaf Gurkha Tea. Grown in the foothills of Mt Kanchenjunga, on the steep hills of Shree Antu at an elevation of over 5900ft, the cloud washed leaves would make a perfect give for any occasions. Choose below from our selection

name: Tea Bags
description: 50 tea bags of fine black tea packed in lovely handcrafted paper bag made using handmade Lokta paper (Nepalese paper). Grown in the foothill of Himalayas, this Ilam tea brews light aromatic liquor, with strong flavour and best served without milk. Packaged in the UK by Kent & Sussex Tea Company Brewing Use freshly drawn water. Brew for 3-4 mins according to taste. Longer brew in very hot water will result tea that is strong and more astringent. Recommended without milk or sugar.
